message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.DB 

This paper deals with the problem of preserving differential privacy for real-valued query functions. This is a problem that is commonly studied in the area of cryptography and security (cs.CR). The paper proposes a new noise probability distribution that is based on a truncated exponential probability density function. This distribution has some similarities with the Laplacian distribution, which is a well-known distribution in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the optimality of the proposed mechanism in various privacy regimes, which is a topic that is often studied in the area of machine learning and statistics (cs.LG). The paper presents some numerical experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed mechanism, which involves the use of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) and databases (cs.DB).
